text: Delicious waffles with fresh, unique toppings. You won't find this anywhere else in Vegas. A must try!
So good!  We had the ultimate waffle with strawberries, bananas,  Nutella and whipped cream.   It was cooked perfectly, just like in Belgium, nice and crispy.

This little shop out front of Bally's  opens early and stays open well past midnight. . Though the menu is simple, you can customize your order. Which making a decision on what to order hard. Definitely get their coffee in the morning. It's better and cheaper than $tar____ (you know who I mean).  Staff is friendly and low pressure. Your order is up quickly and looks exactly like the menu picture. Diabetics avoid at all cost

If there is a zero star that's what I'll give!!!

They are not honest!! All they want is just money!! I came to use my discount coupon from Groupon and because they're Wifi sucks, they're unable to view it right away. So I said let me purchase it first to avoid long line. When purchased was made my discount finally showed up. I showed it to them, then they said they can't honor it because purchased already made. I asked why they can't void it and re-purchase. They declined and said can use it for next time. Will never come back to them!!!
The waffle was good. I had the strawberry one and the strawberries were good as well. The lady and guy who were working there the day I got my waffle were really nice.

I was really excited to have a waffle from the Waffle Bar. The photos I had seen on Yelp looked amazing. The wait from the time we ordered until we received our waffle was a little long. We were quoted 5-7 minutes when we ordered but we waited about 20-25 minutes and there was only one person in front of us who ordered. The waffle looked great once it was ready and tasted really good too. All in all, it was a good experience. I just wished the food came out faster.
Not good at all. Waffle not made fresh. They take premade waffle and toast it. It was so dry!  Not worth the $9 retail cost. I had a groupon and was so glad I did not pay full price for it.

fyi yelp needs to fix some info on this place. first the web site that you click on sends you to their other location in tivoli village. second the place has moved from the Ballys Grand Bazaar shops to the Venetian food court. third all of the pics need to come down from the bazaar shops location and need to be replaced with pics from the new location. other than that the new location is amazing but expensive. if they had one price for all the waffles such as $10. tax included then they'd have a long line bc the waffles are so good!

Only two ladies working so service was kind of slow. They were super nice though! Get the Groupon! Waffles were delicious! It's slightly hard to find. It's near the escalator leading up to Ballys. Try the Berry Delight with Nutella!
Service was like watching a bunch of snails build a castle. I didn't know it was possible to take 30 mins to make a waffle. Overpriced for what it was... even with the Groupon.
This place was brilliant,  my son loved the food and the people were so sweet to him.

Waffles are Delicious! Definitely a must go to place, when visiting Las Vegas!!
Atmosphere is great too! Love, love, love this place!

Wow. I have no idea why anyone would write anything negative about this place. The gentlemen at the counter couldn't have been nicer, and the waffles were absolutely delicious. My wife and I got the strawberry and banana waffles, we split them...and they were wonderful!
Next time we're in Las Vegas we will definitely stop by there again. (And, yes, we did use a Groupon, too)

I'm not too big on sweets, so when my friend decided to stop here I wasn't too excited especially because I was starving. I had the sweet and savory which exceeded all of my expectations! This was the perfect way to kick off the festivities! 
With a full day of drinking and walking in the desert, I was good to go! I will definitely stop by and try one of there fresh fruit items while I'm still here.

Chicken and waffles are a joke. Chicken is nothing like picture and is aweful breaking. Not the nice fried chicken like the picture. Don't get this.
Waffle was good though.

I was super excited to try this place during my stay and it really wasn't what I had expected. Overall it was pretty good I just wish the waffles were either fresh or actually warm and maybe a little bit sweeter. This is a super cute idea for a food place and could be super successful with a few changes

Found this guys on Groupon...

Is an ok place to just relax outside and watch people walk by while you eat a dessert.

Not a big fan, i think waffles are a bit bland and dry...

maybe i'll give it another try next time i'm in town to make a final conclusion. Right now coin up in the air not sure if i wanna give it a thumbs up and or down.

Stand by...

Yes! A thousand times yes! 

This place is so good. THE best chicken and waffles I've ever had. The chicken was perfect, but the waffles were magical. Don't pass this place up!

This place was not good at all.  This is supposed to be an authentic Liege Waffle.  We fell in love with Liege Waffles in Europe (which are different than a Belgium Waffle for breakfast) so we always searching out the real thing wherever we go.  I have had them that were great since returning from Europe and I was excited to try this place.  I was shocked to find that the base waffle with just powdered sugar cost me $9.72!  There were half that in Europe (and that's with the currency conversion). Oh well, I bought one anyways because we were on vacation.  Once I paid, I saw the cook, unwrap a precooked waffle and put it in a toaster.  Are you kidding?  $9 for a reheated waffle!  Oh well, open mind right.  Then we tasted it.  It was dry and lacked the dense chew of a real Liege Waffle.  It also lacked the caramelized bits of pearl sugar that form on the outside ridges.  We literally threw the waffle away.  Not that it was so disgusting to finish; it just wasn't good, so why waste calories.  
Sam's Club sells Liege -ish waffles prepackaged for a fraction of the cost and they are way better (although nothing like the real thing).
I would recommend avoiding this place.  It wont be around long anyways.
On a positive the note, the two workers at the booth were very nice.

My waffle had a really good texture and had plenty of strawberries and bananas.

Only negative is the price but it's located inside Venetian (Strip) so it's sort of expected.

Food came out extremely fast - I was happy because I was starving! Tasted healthy (arguably it was because of the fruit) because I said no to the whipped cream.

Ask for syrup! It's not provided.

Great waffle place! Very friendly staff. The only thing that would be nice to know ahead of time is that the waffle takes about 10 min to cook. Thankfully I wasnt in a rush, but other people might be. In addition, the banana waffle does not come with nutella. Its an extra $1.50 if you want it, but I didnt realize that until I had to pay. But otherwise the waffle was delicious! Crispy, chewy, and fluffy all at the same time! So delicious and big enough for two to share! Would go back again if I was in the area.

Overrated. I ordered the nutella waffle. While the waffle was crispy and hot, I couldn't taste the sugar bits and the waffle was too dense. If you've ever had Waffle Window in Portland, that place is 100x better; Waffle Bar is not even comparable.

Great idea but a bit disappointing experience. Nutella and banana waffle was very good, so stick to their dessert waffles.  The "sandwich" waffle with turkey and ham with a pesto spread was pretty bad.  Quality of meat was that of cheap processed deli meats.  Just didn't work and at $14.00 a real rip-off.  Plus the entire experience was topped off by them wanting to charge me for some tap water to go with my sandwich.  Not for the water, but $0.80 for the cup!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Even with my groupon for this place, not worth it..

I ordered the Nutella waffle and it was DELICIOUS! The waffle was the perfect amount of crispiness with a soft warm center and had enough Nutella drizzled on top.

My only complaint was how long it took to get the waffle. With no place to sit and wait, I was disappointed in the 15 minutes it took to get one waffle. The staff was very friendly but moved with no sense of urgency. If you're in a rush, consider coming back another time.

We had the breakfast sandwich and the strawberry waffle. The breakfast sandwich consisted of grilled ham, melted cheddar cheese and freshly fried egg. Perfect combination of flavors on that slightly sweet Belgium Liege waffle (drizzled some maple syrup over it, just because). The strawberry waffle was a Belgium Liege waffle topped with lots of fresh strawberries then lots of whipped cream. Could have had drizzle of chocolate, caramel or another sauce on top of the whipped cream. So good, didn't need syrup or anything drizzled on top.

Stopped off for brunch. We waited forever and the chicken waffle was gross. Not sure I'd even call it fried chicken. I know it's the food court at the Venetian but damn, try anything else. Even the coffee sucked.

As someone that has very low tolerance to sweetness, this place still catches my stomach.

I was walking around and saw this and felt like some waffles but not too sweet and unhealthy. So I asked the workers to put less whip cream and rejected their offer of adding some Nutella. 

Waffle was freshly made after 5-10 minutes, and it has the perfect combination of the waffle itself, a bit of whip cream and a lot of fresh strawberries! 

I really appreciate them making it with heart and how friendly they are.

Was looking for cheaper different breakfast while staying at the Venetian. This store is located in the canal shoppes food court. I ordered the strawberry waffle with a side order of bacon. The waffle was not really that good and the bacon was kind of sad looking and tasting. It was also very small. The strawberries were fresh but the waffle itself didn't taste good. Next time I'll just eat the breakfast buffet at the grand lux as looking for a cheaper option ended up poorly.
The waffle sandwich with ham is awesome!! Was skeptic let but it was delicious. Also they have Dr. Pepper which you cannot find in any Harrah's property. Will be back tomorrow!

Divinely crafted bananas and strawberries treasure with a handmade waffle-Heaven in a box. Pure delight in both presentation and taste. Server was sincerely warm and friendly towards me. Will return for another scrumptious, sweet treat.

Unfortunately, the Waffle Bar in Tivoli Village isn't getting the traffic it deserves. It should be in Downtown Summerlin or Container Park.

The waffles are good. Really good if you like paying more for less. These are tasty for sure but you get 1/2 the waffle for 2x the price. Also not crazy about the predetermined flavors. It could be better w a create your own topping option.

This place isn't too bad. My only complaint is the wait and seating. Using premade and cut dough, it took over 10 minutes for my family to get their food with no one in line ahead of us. So if you're starving, you're better off going somewhere else. As for seating, there is none. This makes using the knife and fork they give you to eat the waffle difficult. My mom got coffee from the nearby Starbucks and we sat there. As for the food, it was ok. I got the strawberry delight and my step dad got the breakfast waffle. It wasn't bad but we wouldn't eat there again. It was nothing special. My boyfriend, however got the pizza waffle and immediately regretted if. He described it as a sugary, cheap, pizza. The staff was sweet, though!
I ordered the breakfast sandwich and the strawberry delight. Both were very tasty but I think it was a little pricey for the amount of food you get.

A small booth in the Bally's new bazaar shopping area.

The staff was friendly and took the time to perfect the waffle.  Even offered to add extra items to make it more delicious.

Waffle was quite pricey at a little under $12, but the worker filled it up with strawberries and bananas.  Way more than the picture.

I have never had a waffle taste so good... the texture was perfect,  not too hard,  not too soft. .. part of me wishes that i had it plain just so i can experience it just the way it is but i had mine with strawberries and cream... and it was pricy but this is one of those times where you get what you pay for... i mean it wasn't small by all means... actually a friend and i shared it and it was perfect
wasn't what I was expecting...it wasn't bad but it wasn't great...way too expensive...out if the way...thankful I used groupon

Tasted doughy... Not a great flavor.  Just ok
Ordered Nutella w banana.  Crispy on the outside but lacks my in flavor

For a little place, it was pretty dang good. 
I had the bacon and egg waffle, so good.

The service was friendly and fast as well.

Give it a try.

This mecca of deliciousness is located in the Grand Bazaar shops, right near the entrance to Bally's and strategically situated near Starbucks. We loved this place so much we got waffles here three or four times during our stay in Vegas. I highly recommend the nutella and strawberry and the nutella and banana. It does take a little time for them to make the waffles, but relax, they are worth the wait. And, you know they are fresh! The service here was always chill and friendly. The base waffle is like $8, so if you want a lot of stuff on it, this waffle can get pricey. But, it's Vegas and these things are so damn tasty. As it says at the bottom of the receipt,, "Authentic Liege waffles are one of life's great indulgences". True dat. Tip- go to Starbucks first, get coffee, enjoy some coffee while they make your waffle, then camp out at the seating in the Bazaar and people watch.

This is my second visit to the waffle bar. 

It's really good and in a secluded area off the strip behind Monte Carlo. 

I went for the pastrami waffle sandwich and waffle fries this time. Last time I had the chicken an waffles with is a classic. 

The pastrami sandwich as perfect texture with just enough cabbage on the side and sauce to bring it all together. The waffle is sweet and the cabbage and pastrami are savory so it goes together well. 

They have flavored water and lemonade that'll knock your socks off.
Charged me for Nutella, then did not put it on my waffle. Still decent waffle just not impressed with the slow, inaccurate service.

It's in grand Bazaar by Ballys hotel and it takes 16 mins waiting for your order to be made as there's only 1 person working. Purchased our waffle with the drinks and she forgot our drink had to go back and ask for it. Nothing extra ordinary the waffles, there's better waffle bars out there.

I've never been to Belgium before and have no idea what an "authentic" liege waffle tastes like.  I found the waffles here to be quite tasty. To others this may be panda express, a knockoff of the "real thing".  To that I retort, Panda Express is pretty darn good.

Four stars if you include the fact that that they have a Groupon for this place and that the food itself is quite tasty.  Big ups for having Crystal hot sauce with your chicken and waffles option, and for using fresh fruit on your waffles.  The size of the waffle is good for one person, and quite filling.  The only trick to this place is actually finding it.  If you come in from the parking structure make a sharp right before you enter the casino.  Walk past the main food court and you'll see this spot around the corner.

Nothing truly memorable to push it in to five-star range, but for what it does and the price it does it at, I'm a pretty big fan :D

To be honest I didn't have very high expectations going into this. How good could waffles from a food court stand possibly be? I was so wrong! The waffle itself had a sweet taste to it even with no syrup! I ordered one of their waffle sandwiches and it was delicious! Exceeded my expectations!

Super yummy waffles!  My friend and I tried the waffle breakfast sandwich and the waffle topped with strawberries.  The waffles themselves were crispy on the outside and nice and soft on the inside.  It was almost like they had a coating of caramelized sugar on the outside - super delicious.  The strawberry topping was fresh and there was a good amount of it.  The whipped cream was also great.  It was just sweet enough and a great addition.  The filling in the breakfast sandwich was cooked to order.  It took a little while to get our order but everything came out hot and the staff was friendly.

Where do I begin???YUM!!! I had a cake batter waffle with Nutella and strawberries and whipped cream!  It was so delicious! It will be my must do every time we are in Vegas! Next time I will try the cookie spread! The young girl that made it was super sweet! It's pretty big especially with the toppings.. Def a meal in itself :)
I loved their original waffle! Got it with the cookie butter and the flavor was better than anticipated. I would've regretted it if I left Vegas without trying it!

Had bought a groupon for this place and was excited to try it when family was in town visiting. Very dissapointed. The waffles look better than they taste. It was hard, like it was premade and warmed in the microwave maybe. The Fruit was fresh though. I expected a soft fluffy waffle with the sugar crystals exploding in my mouth...NOT the case here. They need to re-think their preparation of the waffle. I couldn't even get through half of it. Truly dissatisfied. I gave them a 2 star because of the fresh strawberries.
Breakfast waffle was to die for! Employee was humorous and friendly. He even took the time to organize the tray all straight and pretty. Definitely would make this a habit if I were here long term.

Expensive waffles

Located inside the Venetian by the food courts near the Grand Canal Shoppes (ugh! that business name spelling... I've tried to report the correction to Yelp but they seem to think that that's the right spelling and didn't need to fix) Anyway, we stopped by the Venetian before heading home to claim our Groupon deal at Waffle Bar. 

I had The Nute Waffle while hubby had the Egg & Bacon. The Belgian Liege waffles were flavorful and crunchy but whoa! the thick spread of Nutella and added whipped cream made it sooo sweet that I couldn't... I just couldn't finish it. If I was borderline diabetic... I would've hopped over and became diabetic already. People who know me know that I love my sweets but this was over the top sweet... I should've ordered something else. Their Savory waffles included breakfast and waffle sandwiches and also pizza waffles. The sweet waffles are ones with fruits-- bananas, berries and strawberry. The waffles were quite expensive, my Nutella Waffle was $8.99 and the Egg & Bacon was $9.99. If you could get a Groupon deal then that's great... I wouldn't pay full price.  There's plenty of seating around the area to wait or have your waffles. If you have a late night craving they're open till midnight.

Review #0951
Flavor is good, just the price is a little much, we paid 24 dollars for 2 waffles. I didn't expect that for some waffles.
Literally the best dessert I've had in Vegas.  The waffles are out of this world.  Do yourself a favor and stop here.

I gave this place five stars because we had a sandwich on our way walking to stratosphere and back. This sandwich was huge and pretty filling. I read the reviews about people saying that they didn't get fresh waffles. 
  Our waffles were freshly made and the breakfast sandwich held us over for a long time. Took a chance buying this coupon with the groupon app. 
    11 dollars for 18 dollars worth of waffles. This sandwich was pretty big. 
     Little hard to find this place we had to ask someone to point us in the right direction because it located in the little shopping area in front of Bally's casino all the way in the back. They are a little pricey but it's Vegas and everything is pricey.

Convenient little spot for a quick and delicious breakfast while in Vegas. Right next to a dole whip stand and across the way from Starbucks, this place has a killer breakfast sandwich! It runs at about $12 and is sliced turkey, cheddar cheese and peppered fried egg between two yummy sweet waffles! It's basically "everything you want in a McGriddle but better!" 
This was so filling that we got it two days in a row! 

Minus one star because usually they only have one person working so you do have to wait a little bit for your order. If you can stand to wait  10- 15 mins for your order then you're good to go!

This is a little shop amongst many located right outside the Bally's hotel. The prices are a little high but we had a groupon so we were able to try a few varieties. We ordered strawberry banana with whip cream, half Nutella half cookie butter, and a breakfast sandwich. Waffles are very good, freshly made, which is why the wait time is so long. My only complaint is that the paper they wrap the breakfast sandwich in kinda sticks to the waffle, making it difficult to eat. They have a lot of varieties to choose from and I will return when in Vegas.

The waffle was pretty decent. I'd say not worth 9.99. Maybe thats just me. Also, the banana one another commenter is commenting about is the cheapest one there. Imo the best one. Plan on sitting down its pretty messy!

Ever since my first liege waffle in Canada I've had a serious liege obsession. Why does anyone even make the waffles from batter when liege exists?

This location is a stand located in the Bazaar Shops area near Bally's. After ordering at the window you can take it to go or there are seats in the center area to rest while enjoying your waffle.

The waffles run just under $10 per waffle. I have mixed feelings about this because it's one waffle and really isn't worth $10. On the other hand I get that this shopping center probably has high rent for tenants which is going to automatically increase the price of anything in the plaza. It took a minute or two to even be greeted even though we were the only people at the register. It also took awhile for our waffle to come up which the man apologized for, but they only offer waffles so I'm not sure what the wait was about. It did seem like they could benefit from the assembly line idea. Since there were two people working I would suggest one person handle the register and calling out orders while the other person handles food preparation. 

The most important part if the actual waffle. It was tasty and thick like a liege waffle should be. The whipped cream was delicious and the strawberries on top were fresh. The waffle was not as sweet as other liege waffles I've had and was not the best liege waffle ever. The liege waffle is hard to find so this is definitely still a good option for the area, but not the best there is in general.

The waffles are so delicious themselves, like nothing I've ever had before! The waffles are sweet and have a vanilla flavor. There are tons of options on different toppings. You can go for a sweet or savory route. The service was quick and the people were nice. Love this place!
Fresh delicious waffles! Got the strawberry one and the strawberries and cream were super fresh. Simple waffle and fruit and not overly sweet! Great dessert or snack.

Yum! Authentic Belgian liege waffles in the Vegas Strip. Would have never known to have found this gem of a place while visiting the city. This little outdoor food stall offers some great and authentic Belgian style waffles. I was in the mood for a simple waffle with no toppings or anything. Didn't want the extra sugar and the prices were quite steep as it is. The plain Belgian waffle was so delicious, buttery and crispy! The pearl sugar in each bite brought a caramelized taste. Smelled like a sweet and simple crepe. I had always wanted to try this type of waffle and I finally got to. If you're looking for a unique sweet treat, then I urge you to visit this little stall. It certainly aroused my attention after mostly observing cookie cutter restaurants and places to eat in the strip. Oh and it's a sweet treat that is quite big so it's easy to share with others.
Do not...i repeat...DO NOT order the chicken and waffles! Unless you want microwaved chicken strips on top of your waffles!

Great customer service! 

Had an amazing turkey waffle sandwich with pesto sauce, it rocked my world. 

I can't wait to go back & try the waffle pizza!

My daughter loved the churros.  She ordered and ate two every day for three days straight.  Great customer service and nice people.  The price is right!  It is conveniently located near Bally's and Wahlbergers and Giordanos.  Lots of great places to eat in a small radius.

So delicious! $12.00 for a strawberry, banana and Nutella waffle! With whip cream and Drizzled with sugar and more Nutella! Fruit was really fresh, freshly cut bananas. Done in a timely matter approximately 5-6 minutes.
I was torn between the strawberry/banana and Nutella waffle so the employee hooked me up and combined them! Delicious!

I stumbled upon this little gem whilst wandering the streets looking for breakfast.  I got the Banana Nana Waffle and added cookie butter.   If you've never had cookie butter, stop reading this and go out and get some.  You're welcome. 

The waffle itself probably wasn't anything to write home about but the combo of waffle, cookie butter, bananas, and whipped cream was a home run!  It was pure sugary, delicious gluttony and I regret nothing!   Also, I got waffle to go and was pleasantly surprised at how it still had some crunch and wasn't a soggy mess by the time I got back to the room. 

I'm giving this exact combo five stars.  I also tried the breakfast sandwich and wasn't a fan.  But who cares because cookie butter!
Terrible! The waffles are WAY to hard. You also cannot taste or even tell that there are sugar pearls in the waffle. Not authentic. Way to expensive and NOT worth it. Very disappointed.

Best waffles ever. Love Nia. She recognized my daughter and I from way back in February.  We really missed the churros this trip. Please bring them back. See you at the Venetian next time. Can't wait.

Wow!  This place does an EXCELLENT waffle.

The lines are long at the breakfast spots early on the convention opening morning at the Venetian. So I wandered to the food court looking for something a little less crowded and a little more imaginative.  FOUND IT

I tried the breakfast waffle. The waffles are cooked to order (8 minutes). 2 fried eggs, also cooked to order, 4 strips of crisp bacon and 2 slices of cheddar top the waffle.

These are liege waffles, known for including belgian pearl sugar in the batter. When cooked the sugar caramelizes to yield a sweet, crunchy on the outside, moist on the inside perfect waffle.

It's not cheap ($9.99), but this is as good of a waffle I've ever had. Can't wait til later when I'll come back for another one for dessert.

Last day of our weekend trip, which is a Sunday morning, my wife bought a Groupon for this place as we always do (deals on Groupon).  I am not much of a waffle guy but I can't complain.  This particular branch/franchise is located inside the Venetian in a small area where the food court starts and I believe extends to shopping stores.  

I had the scramble eggs and bacon with maple syrup.  It was pretty tasty but simply done.  I believe my wife had chocolate with icing over her waffles (I could be wrong).  Don't know if she really enjoyed hers because I recall that hers was a little too sweet.  The only thing is that they didn't have any water when I asked for a cup on the side , I have to purchase for 2.50$.  All in all it was just a short and sweet stay to eat.

Sure wish I could have tried this waffle! I purchased this deal on groupon and could not wait to try on our way back to Cali. 
After waking up from a hungover night, we decided to get up early and walk to the waffle bar so we could take advantage of sitting in the Las Vegas sun eating waffles on our last day in Vegas.

After walking through Ballys we finally got to the waffle bar only to be told that they were out of waffle mix and we would need to come back later! So let me get this straight... a waffle bar out of waffles on a Sunday morning?! 

Although I was super annoyed and hungry, I nicely asked the lady if we could use the groupon for something else, I noticed doughnuts, juices...etc and she said No, there was nothing she could do. 

I was so baffled by this I walked in a circle for a minute trying to comprehend what was happening but needless to say, this place won't last long if they keep this up. They are in a brand new area in the center of the strip...Tourist surround you and if you're going to be a waffle bar that runs out of waffles at least give me a resolution, don't send me away empty handed. Horrible service, never tasted the waffles.

If you're wanting something a little different but not completely wacky, this is a good stop.I had a waffle with pulled pork.The waffle itself seemed ordinary but the pulled pork it held was very good.

So good. Came here to enjoy some waffles and they were amazing. I ordered the breakfast waffle and my friend got the strawberry one and they both were delicious. Warm and fresh. The lady working was so sweet and helpful she made ordering a breeze

I went there with my husband and a few friends. Customer service was excellent. Everything and I mean everything looked appetizing, therefor we had to order one of each kind. Talk about love at first bite! We enjoyed every morsal. The Berry Delight and Banana Nana were my favorites!  Can't wait to go back in November. Hopefully by then they expand their delectable menu. Maybe chicken and waffles for those Vegas hangovers ;-)

Friendly service, price is about average for anything in Vegas on the strip. The shop is located in front of Bally's in the new 'grand bazaar' area, pretty much right in front of the escalators up to Bally's. They were very friendly, and as quick as they can be while making the waffles fresh. We had a waffle sandwich and one with bananas. My husband opted to add the cookie butter to the bananas one. It was fantastic! I was worried it would be too heavy and overly sweet, but it was perfectly made. The batter they are using is fantastic.

Thanks!

The Liege waffle was everything I expected it be and more! They don't make the waffle until it has been ordered and is then prepared fresh. I tried the Nutella and it was AMAZING! Nice & warm.... dusted in sugar powder and spread with the nutella, heaven!  Can't wait for my next trip out to the strip.
My wife and I went there and the waffles were awesome, I had the one with the Nutella and my wife are the ones with the bananas and whip cream

In the mood for something different for breakfast so I decided to cash in my Groupon. We started out walking then decided to jump in a cab. The cab was dirty with hair everywhere. I was grossed out and could not wait to get out cab. We arrived safely. Walked into the Venetian up the escalator to the 2nd floor to the food court. There was many food establishments to choose from. There was a line at the Waffle Bar. We were acknowledged and ask to wait a few for our order to be taken. 

There were 2 ladies behind the counter taking orders and making orders. They changed their gloves with every order. They were a bit unorganized. I ordered the berry waffle which was a waffle with strawberry and whipped cream. My friend ordered the breakfast waffle with turkey, 2 fried eggs, and cheese. 

When the order was ready it sat on the counter inter my friend asked if it was our order. The problem came when I noticed my waffle had bananas. I advised that I didn't order that particular waffle since I'm allergic to bananas. I was told that I did order that particular waffle which makes no since. She was combative and finally made a new waffle with no bananas. Surprisingly she was not the one who took the order. 

Once I received our correct order we sat down in the community seating area. It was clean. The berry waffle had fresh cut strawberries and it was a bit sweet without the syrup that was provided. My friend said the waffle breakfast sandwich tasted different and he was still hungry after finishing the sandwich. My berry waffle had a little darkness on the bottom, maybe from a spray on the griddle. 

The waffles range from $8.99 to $13. 

Also the ladies behind the counter did not have a hair net on which was a shock to me.

AMAZING!!!! LOVED THIS Place! 
Try the Nutella and Banana! This place Rocks! Great for our morning breakfast along with a Starbucks and kept us full until about mid afternoon. I would DEFINITELY give this 5+ if I could. 
I read the reviews, do not know how people rated this place bad. Try and you will be hooked too!
Great tasting waffles with amazing customer service! Only wish they were a sit down restaurant!

I really wish I could give this place 0 stars. Wow, this place is an embarrassment to waffles. I feel insulted they served me a hardened waffle in a paper bowl with plastic utensils that couldn't even cut through the damn waffle... I mean really the batter used for the waffles clearly isn't good and the "fresh" fruit that goes on top is nasty and soggy  (caramelized - as I would say in a polite way). The strawberries on top were just old and the waffle itself was hard and tasteless. The costumer service was a bit rude too. Not to mention it's around $10 for one waffle and the wait was surprisingly long due to understaff. I am not one to bash on restaurants, but WOW - I am disappointed.

Waiting for over 35 minutes. There were 8 people in front of me. There is no hurry at this location.

Waffles are pretty good. I would enjoy them again, but will not wait.  That wait time is inexcusable. 41 minutes total from order to pick up for a single  waffle.

Looked all over for this place. Wish I would have known from the beginning that it was upstairs in the canal shops food court. That would have saved me from going on a wild goose chase. I hope this much of my review will help someone. 

Anyway, I've never had a Liege waffle before. I had no idea what to expect. I ordered the chicken and waffle. My first impression was the waffle was very dense and caky. It had a caramelized outer shell that was slightly sweet. The inside seemed slightly under cooked. Overall, the flavor of the waffle was good, however, the chicken did not taste fresh. It had burnt tips and edges as if it were made in a toaster oven. The batter was very hard. I think if the chicken was freshly deep fried it would have been much better. 

My wife had a breakfast sandwich. Eggs were cooked fresh in a pan, which was a huge plus. So glad it was not in a microwave. 

Based on my experience, I would love to try a desert waffle from this place. I think these waffles would go well with some ice cream or some sweet toppings and a coffee. Not a fan of the savory versions and would not order them again. 

They make everything to order. Our waffles came out about 13 minutes from the time we ordered to the time they handed over the waffles. Not sure what they would do if it were a little busier. We were the only order so the turn around time seemed long.

I did notice that the person prepping the order constantly changed her glove as she handled different ingredients. Huge plus for being sanitary and avoiding cross contamination. 

If I'm in the area I would give this place another shot for a desert waffle. Until next time.

Great concept, tasty food, good variety, long wait time. 

I'm over at the Tivoli Village location. There is no one here but me and one lady. I ordered 2 things and it took her 25 minutes to make this. Just ridiculous!

Not impressed.  I detected NO pearl sugar what so ever.  My waffle was thick, bland and had a very fermented yeasty taste.  On the upside, the fruit was fresh and plentiful.  No ice cream available which would have made it more tolerable.  The waffle was undercooked and sort of doughy.  The one person working insisted I give him an American penny when I accidentally handed him a Canadian penny.  I said It's no big deal, its just a penny and he said " Its a big deal to me".  Ok, dude.  Chill.   All that aside, I did not like this waffle at all.
